Package battleship

Class Ocean

java.lang.Object
battleship.Ocean
public class Ocean
extends java.lang.Object
Class of the 10X10 ocean

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private int hitCount
    The number of times a shot hit a ship.
    private Ship[][] ships
    Used to quickly determine which ship is in any given location
    private int shipsSunk
    The number of ships sunk (10 ships in all)
    private int shotsFired
    The total number of shots fired by the user

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Ocean()
    Creates an ocean initializes any game variables, such as how many shots have been fired.

    To initialize the empty ocean
    (package private) boolean isGameOver()
    Check if the game is over.
    (package private) boolean isOccupied​(int row, int column)
    Returns true if the given location contains a real ship, still afloat,false if it does not.
    (package private) void placeAllShipsRandomly()
    Place all ten ships randomly on the (initially empty) ocean.
    (package private) void print()
    Prints the Ocean.
    (package private) boolean shootAt​(int row, int column)
    Returns true if the given location contains a real ship, still afloat, (not an EmptySea), false if it does not.

  • Field Details

    • ships

      private Ship[][] ships
      Used to quickly determine which ship is in any given location

    • shotsFired

      private int shotsFired
      The total number of shots fired by the user

    • hitCount

      private int hitCount
      The number of times a shot hit a ship. If the user shoots the same part of a ship more than once, every hit is counted, even though additional hits do the user any good.

    • shipsSunk

      private int shipsSunk
      The number of ships sunk (10 ships in all)

  • Constructor Details

    • Ocean

      public Ocean()
      Creates an ocean initializes any game variables, such as how many shots have been fired.

  • Method Details

    • initialOcean

      private void initialOcean()
      To initialize the empty ocean

    • placeAllShipsRandomly

      void placeAllShipsRandomly()
      Place all ten ships randomly on the (initially empty) ocean. Place larger ships before smaller ones,

    • isOccupied

      boolean isOccupied​(int row, int column)
      Returns true if the given location contains a real ship, still afloat,false if it does not. In addition, this method updates the number of shots that have been fired, and the number of hits.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      Returns:
      True if there is a ship

    • getShotsFired

      int getShotsFired()
      Get shots you have fired.
      Returns:
      the number of shots fired (in the game)

    • getHitCount

      int getHitCount()
      Get hits you already hit.
      Returns:
      the number of hits recorded (in the game). All hits are counted, not just the first time a given square is hit.

    • shootAt

      boolean shootAt​(int row, int column)
      Returns true if the given location contains a real ship, still afloat, (not an EmptySea), false if it does not. In addition, this method updates the number of shots that have been fired, and the number of hits.
      Parameters:
      row -
      column -
      Returns:

    • getShipsSunk

      int getShipsSunk()
      Get if the ship is sunk.
      Returns:
      the number of ships sunk (in the game)

    • isGameOver

      boolean isGameOver()
      Check if the game is over.
      Returns:
      true if all ships have been sunk, otherwise false

    • getShipArray

      Ship[][] getShipArray()
      Get ships array from ocean.
      Returns:
      the 10x10 array of Ships

    • print

      void print()
      Prints the Ocean. The top left corner square should be 0, 0. Use "x" to indicate a location that you have fired upon and hit a (real) ship. Use "-" to indicate a location that you have fired upon and found nothing there. Use "s" to indicate a location containing a sunken ship. and use "." (a period) to indicate a location that you have never fired upon.
